definitions.usage_example: Can you pick up that pencil for me?
definitions.alternative_example: Can you lift that pencil for me?

definitions.usage_example: I need to pick up my kids from school.
definitions.alternative_example: I need to collect my kids from school.
definitions.usage_example_es: Tengo que recoger a mis hijos del colegio.

definitions.usage_example: The phone is ringing. Please pick it up.
definitions.alternative_example: The phone is ringing. Please answer it.
definitions.usage_example_es: El teléfono está sonando. Por favor, contéstalo.

definitions.usage_example: You need to pick up your room.
definitions.alternative_example: You need to tidy your room.

definitions.usage_example: I picked up some Spanish in Medellín.
definitions.alternative_example: I learned some Spanish (casually) in Medellín.
definitions.usage_example_es: Aprendí algo de español en Medellín.

definitions.usage_example: I need to pick out a gift for my mom.
definitions.alternative_example: I need to choose a gift for my mom.
definitions.usage_example_es: Necesito elegir un regalo para mi mamá.

definitions.usage_example: He always picks on his little brother.
definitions.alternative_example: He always teases his little brother.
definitions.usage_example_es: Él siempre se mete con su hermano pequeño.

definitions.usage_example: She is just picking at her food.
definitions.alternative_example: She is eating her food without appetite.
definitions.usage_example_es: Ella solo está picoteando su comida.
